pkgmetadata.longdescription: Piece-Wise Exponential Additive Mixed Modeling Tools for Survival Analysis // The Piece-wise exponential (Additive Mixed) Model (PAMM; Bender and Scheipl (2018) doi: 10.1177/1471082X17748083) is a powerful model class for the analysis of survival (or time-to-event) data, based on Generalized Additive (Mixed) Models (GA(M)Ms). It offers intuitive specification and robust estimation of complex survival models with stratified baseline hazards, random effects, time-varying effects, time-dependent covariates and cumulative effects (Bender and others (2018) doi: 10.1093/biostatistics/kxy003, as well as support for left- truncated, competing risks and recurrent events data. pammtools provides tidy workflow for survival analysis with PAMMs, including data simulation, transformation and other functions for data preprocessing and model post-processing as well as visualization.
